programmes.show_description: (2023) Unsettling found-footage horror with David Dastmalchian. A has-been host tries to save his 70s talk show using a demonically possessed 13-year-old girl. Really, what could go wrong?
(2023) Farcical time-loop comedy about the staff and guests at a remote mountain hotel condemned to repeat the same two minutes over, and over, and over, and over again. In Japanese/subs.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
...Weapon: (1942) WWII spy adventure starring Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce. Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson attempt to prevent the Nazis from acquiring a revolutionary invention.
(1960) Fantasy adventure. Claude Rains plays a scientist who, convinced that dinosaurs still roam the earth, sets off into the Amazon to find them. Based on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's novel.
(1997) Action thriller starring Pierce Brosnan and Linda Hamilton. The inhabitants of a volcano-side resort unwisely ignore a scientist's warning about its imminent eruption.
(2017) Fantasy adventure sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black. Four teenagers are sucked into the Jumanji video game to complete a dangerous quest.
(2016) Sci-fi blockbuster sequel starring Jeff Goldblum and Liam Hemsworth. Twenty years after Earth repelled a devastating alien invasion, the extraterrestrials return to finish the job.
(2022) Creepy-doll horror with Allison Williams. A robotics engineer simultaneously invents an AI dolly and takes on the care of her orphaned niece. But can a cyborg really raise a kid?
(2013) All-American action thriller starring Channing Tatum and Jamie Foxx. A Capitol police officer steps up to protect the President when the White House is compromised.
(2005) Gael Garcia Bernal plays an ex-navy rating who infiltrates pastor William Hurt's family to exact revenge for a wrong suffered by his mother. Sex/violence/strong language from start.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
...Abigail Gorman: Abigail is a well-known activist and campaigner. We follow her through an ADHD diagnosis and ask her what the future might hold.
Teleshopping.
(1951) Korean War drama about the stress of battle. Officers drop one by one as a US platoon fights a rearguard action, leaving one unwilling man (Richard Basehart) to take their place.
(1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.
(1957) Western starring Randolph Scott and John Carroll. A man seeking revenge for his wife's death tracks his rival down in the sleepy town of Sundown...
(1966) Western with Maureen O'Hara and James Stewart. With the help of a drifter, a widow strives to fulfil her husband's last wish to introduce rare cattle to the perilous American west.
(2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.
(2023) Eva Longoria directs the real-life story of Richard Monta√±ez - the Latino janitor who invented Flamin' Hot Cheetos, aka the 'world's most popular snack'. Starring Jesse Garcia.
(2022) Fact-based drama with Elizabeth Banks and Sigourney Weaver. An underground abortion network helps a woman with a life-threatening pregnancy in pre-Roe-v-Wade America.
